intro: Licania poeppigii, commonly known as the red-stemmed licania, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Licania poeppigii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
